trans-unit.source: Create and manage a SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Create and manage a SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Create and manage an Azure SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Create and manage an Azure SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Create and manage a SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Create and manage a SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to create and manage a SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to create and manage a SQL Database elastic database pool using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: The individual steps to create an elastic database pool with Azure PowerShell are broken out and explained for clarity.
trans-unit.target: The individual steps to create an elastic database pool with Azure PowerShell are broken out and explained for clarity.

trans-unit.source: For those who simply want a concise list of commands, see the Putting it all together section at the bottom of this article.
trans-unit.target: For those who simply want a concise list of commands, see the Putting it all together section at the bottom of this article.

trans-unit.source: This article will show you how to create everything you need to create and configure an elastic database pool except for the Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: This article will show you how to create everything you need to create and configure an elastic database pool except for the Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you need an Azure subscription simply click FREE TRIAL at the top of this page, and then come back to finish this article.
trans-unit.target: If you need an Azure subscription simply click FREE TRIAL at the top of this page, and then come back to finish this article.

trans-unit.source: Elastic database pools are currently in preview, and only available with SQL Database V12 servers.
trans-unit.target: Elastic database pools are currently in preview, and only available with SQL Database V12 servers.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To create an elastic database pool with PowerShell, you need to have Azure PowerShell installed and running, and switch it into resource manager mode to access the Azure Resource Manager PowerShell Cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: To create an elastic database pool with PowerShell, you need to have Azure PowerShell installed and running, and switch it into resource manager mode to access the Azure Resource Manager PowerShell Cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: You can download and install the Azure PowerShell modules by running the <link><linkText>Microsoft Web Platform Installer</linkText><title></title></link>. For detailed information, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can download and install the Azure PowerShell modules by running the <link><linkText>Microsoft Web Platform Installer</linkText><title></title></link>. For detailed information, see <link><linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlets for creating and managing Azure SQL Databases and elastic database pools are located in the Azure Resource Manager module.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlets for creating and managing Azure SQL Databases and elastic database pools are located in the Azure Resource Manager module.

trans-unit.source: When you start Azure PowerShell, the cmdlets in the Azure module are imported by default.
trans-unit.target: When you start Azure PowerShell, the cmdlets in the Azure module are imported by default.

trans-unit.source: To switch to the Azure Resource Manager module, use the Switch-AzureMode cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To switch to the Azure Resource Manager module, use the Switch-AzureMode cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information, see <link><linkText>Using Windows PowerShell with Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information, see <link><linkText>Using Windows PowerShell with Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure your credentials and select your subscription
trans-unit.target: Configure your credentials and select your subscription

trans-unit.source: Now that you are running the Azure Resource Manager module you have access to all the necessary cmdlets to create and configure an elastic database pool.
trans-unit.target: Now that you are running the Azure Resource Manager module you have access to all the necessary cmdlets to create and configure an elastic database pool.

trans-unit.source: First you must establish access to your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: First you must establish access to your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: Run the following and you will be presented with a sign in screen to enter your credentials.
trans-unit.target: Run the following and you will be presented with a sign in screen to enter your credentials.

trans-unit.source: Use the same email and password that you use to sign in to the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Use the same email and password that you use to sign in to the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: After successfully signing in you should see some information on screen that includes the Id you signed in with and the Azure subscriptions you have access to.
trans-unit.target: After successfully signing in you should see some information on screen that includes the Id you signed in with and the Azure subscriptions you have access to.

trans-unit.source: Select your Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Select your Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: To select the subscription you need your subscription Id or subscription name (-SubscriptionName).
trans-unit.target: To select the subscription you need your subscription Id or subscription name (-SubscriptionName).

trans-unit.source: You can copy it from the previous step, or if you have multiple subscriptions you can run the Get-AzureSubscription cmdlet and copy the desired subscription information from the resultset.
trans-unit.target: You can copy it from the previous step, or if you have multiple subscriptions you can run the Get-AzureSubscription cmdlet and copy the desired subscription information from the resultset.

trans-unit.source: Once you have your subscription run the following cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Once you have your subscription run the following cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: Create a resource group, server, and firewall rule
trans-unit.target: Create a resource group, server, and firewall rule

trans-unit.source: Now you have access to run cmdlets against your Azure subscription so the next step is establishing the resource group that contains the server where the elastic database pool will be created.
trans-unit.target: Now you have access to run cmdlets against your Azure subscription so the next step is establishing the resource group that contains the server where the elastic database pool will be created.

trans-unit.source: You can edit the next command to use whatever valid location you choose.
trans-unit.target: You can edit the next command to use whatever valid location you choose.

trans-unit.source: Run (Get-AzureLocation | where-object {$_.Name -eq "Microsoft.Sql/servers" }).Locations to get a list of valid locations.
trans-unit.target: Run (Get-AzureLocation | where-object {$_.Name -eq "Microsoft.Sql/servers" }).Locations to get a list of valid locations.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a resource group you can go to the next step, or you can run the following command to create a new resource group:
trans-unit.target: If you already have a resource group you can go to the next step, or you can run the following command to create a new resource group:

trans-unit.source: Create a server
trans-unit.target: Create a server

trans-unit.source: Elastic database pools are created inside Azure SQL Database servers.
trans-unit.target: Elastic database pools are created inside Azure SQL Database servers.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a server you can go to the next step, or you can run the following command to create a new V12 server.
trans-unit.target: If you already have a server you can go to the next step, or you can run the following command to create a new V12 server.

trans-unit.source: Replace the ServerName with the name for your server.
trans-unit.target: Replace the ServerName with the name for your server.

trans-unit.source: It must be unique to Azure SQL Servers so you may get an error here if the server name is already taken.
trans-unit.target: It must be unique to Azure SQL Servers so you may get an error here if the server name is already taken.

trans-unit.source: Also worth noting is that this command may take several minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: Also worth noting is that this command may take several minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: The server details and PowerShell prompt will appear after the server is successfully created.
trans-unit.target: The server details and PowerShell prompt will appear after the server is successfully created.

trans-unit.source: You can edit the command to use whatever valid location you choose.
trans-unit.target: You can edit the command to use whatever valid location you choose.

trans-unit.source: When you run this command a window opens asking for a User name and Password.
trans-unit.target: When you run this command a window opens asking for a User name and Password.

trans-unit.source: This is not your Azure credentials, enter the user name and password that will be the administrator credentials you want to create for the new server.
trans-unit.target: This is not your Azure credentials, enter the user name and password that will be the administrator credentials you want to create for the new server.

trans-unit.source: Configure a server firewall rule to allow access to the server
trans-unit.target: Configure a server firewall rule to allow access to the server

trans-unit.source: Establish a firewall rule to access the server.
trans-unit.target: Establish a firewall rule to access the server.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command replacing the start and end IP addresses with valid values for your computer.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command replacing the start and end IP addresses with valid values for your computer.

trans-unit.source: If your server needs to allow access to other Azure services, add the -AllowAllAzureIPs switch that will add a special firewall rule and allow all azure traffic access to the server.
trans-unit.target: If your server needs to allow access to other Azure services, add the -AllowAllAzureIPs switch that will add a special firewall rule and allow all azure traffic access to the server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create an elastic database pool, and elastic databases
trans-unit.target: Create an elastic database pool, and elastic databases

trans-unit.source: Now you have a resource group, a server, and a firewall rule configured so you can access the server.
trans-unit.target: Now you have a resource group, a server, and a firewall rule configured so you can access the server.

trans-unit.source: The following command will create the elastic database pool.
trans-unit.target: The following command will create the elastic database pool.

trans-unit.source: This command creates a pool that shares a total of 400 eDTUs.
trans-unit.target: This command creates a pool that shares a total of 400 eDTUs.

trans-unit.source: Each database in the pool is guaranteed to always have 10 eDTUs available (DatabaseDtuMin).
trans-unit.target: Each database in the pool is guaranteed to always have 10 eDTUs available (DatabaseDtuMin).

trans-unit.source: Individual databases in the pool can consume a maximum of 100 eDTUs (DatabaseDtuMax).
trans-unit.target: Individual databases in the pool can consume a maximum of 100 eDTUs (DatabaseDtuMax).

trans-unit.source: For detailed parameter explanations, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database elastic pools</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed parameter explanations, see <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database elastic pools</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create or add elastic databases into an elastic database pool
trans-unit.target: Create or add elastic databases into an elastic database pool

trans-unit.source: The pool created in the previous step is empty, it has no elastic databases in it.
trans-unit.target: The pool created in the previous step is empty, it has no elastic databases in it.

trans-unit.source: The following sections show how to create new elastic databases inside of the pool, and also how to add existing databases into the pool.
trans-unit.target: The following sections show how to create new elastic databases inside of the pool, and also how to add existing databases into the pool.

trans-unit.source: *After creating a pool you can also use Transact-SQL for creating new elastic databases in the pool, and moving existing databases in and out of a pool.
trans-unit.target: *After creating a pool you can also use Transact-SQL for creating new elastic databases in the pool, and moving existing databases in and out of a pool.

trans-unit.source: For details see, <link><linkText>Elastic database pool reference - Transact-SQL</linkText><title></title></link>.*
trans-unit.target: For details see, <link><linkText>Elastic database pool reference - Transact-SQL</linkText><title></title></link>.*

trans-unit.source: Create a new elastic database inside an elastic database pool
trans-unit.target: Create a new elastic database inside an elastic database pool

trans-unit.source: To create a new database directly inside a pool, use the New-AzureSqlDatabase cmdlet and set the ElasticPoolName parameter.
trans-unit.target: To create a new database directly inside a pool, use the New-AzureSqlDatabase cmdlet and set the ElasticPoolName parameter.

trans-unit.source: Move an existing database into an elastic database pool
trans-unit.target: Move an existing database into an elastic database pool

trans-unit.source: To move an existing database into a pool, use the Set-AzureSqlDatabase cmdlet and set the ElasticPoolName parameter.
trans-unit.target: To move an existing database into a pool, use the Set-AzureSqlDatabase cmdlet and set the ElasticPoolName parameter.

trans-unit.source: For demonstration, create a database that's not in an elastic database pool.
trans-unit.target: For demonstration, create a database that's not in an elastic database pool.

trans-unit.source: Move the existing database into the elastic database pool.
trans-unit.target: Move the existing database into the elastic database pool.

trans-unit.source: Change performance settings of an elastic database pool
trans-unit.target: Change performance settings of an elastic database pool

trans-unit.source: Monitoring elastic databases and elastic database pools
trans-unit.target: Monitoring elastic databases and elastic database pools

trans-unit.source: Get the status of elastic database pool operations
trans-unit.target: Get the status of elastic database pool operations

trans-unit.source: You can track the status of elastic database pool operations including creation and updates.
trans-unit.target: You can track the status of elastic database pool operations including creation and updates.

trans-unit.source: Get the status of moving an elastic database into and out of an elastic database pool
trans-unit.target: Get the status of moving an elastic database into and out of an elastic database pool

trans-unit.source: Get resource consumption metrics for an elastic database pool
trans-unit.target: Get resource consumption metrics for an elastic database pool

trans-unit.source: Metrics that can be retrieved as a percentage of the resource pool limit:
trans-unit.target: Metrics that can be retrieved as a percentage of the resource pool limit:

trans-unit.source: Average CPU utilization - cpu_percent
trans-unit.target: Average CPU utilization - cpu_percent

trans-unit.source: Average IO utilization - data_io_percent
trans-unit.target: Average IO utilization - data_io_percent

trans-unit.source: Average Log utilization - log_write_percent
trans-unit.target: Average Log utilization - log_write_percent

trans-unit.source: Average Memory utilization - memory_percent
trans-unit.target: Average Memory utilization - memory_percent

trans-unit.source: Average eDTU utilization (as a max value of CPU/IO/Log utilization) – DTU_percent
trans-unit.target: Average eDTU utilization (as a max value of CPU/IO/Log utilization) – DTU_percent

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of concurrent user requests (workers) – max_concurrent_requests
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of concurrent user requests (workers) – max_concurrent_requests

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of concurrent user sessions – max_concurrent_sessions
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of concurrent user sessions – max_concurrent_sessions

trans-unit.source: Total storage size for the elastic pool – storage_in_megabytes
trans-unit.target: Total storage size for the elastic pool – storage_in_megabytes

trans-unit.source: Metrics granularity/retention periods:
trans-unit.target: Metrics granularity/retention periods:

trans-unit.source: Data will be returned at 5 minute granularity.
trans-unit.target: Data will be returned at 5 minute granularity.

trans-unit.source: Data retention is 14 days.
trans-unit.target: Data retention is 14 days.

trans-unit.source: This cmdlet and API limits the number of rows that can be retrieved in one call to 1000 rows (about 3 days of data at 5 minute granularity).
trans-unit.target: This cmdlet and API limits the number of rows that can be retrieved in one call to 1000 rows (about 3 days of data at 5 minute granularity).

trans-unit.source: But this command can be called multiple times with different start/end time intervals to retrieve more data
trans-unit.target: But this command can be called multiple times with different start/end time intervals to retrieve more data

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the metrics:
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the metrics:

trans-unit.source: Get additional days by repeating the call and appending the data:
trans-unit.target: Get additional days by repeating the call and appending the data:

trans-unit.source: Format the table:
trans-unit.target: Format the table:

trans-unit.target: Export to a CSV file:

trans-unit.source: Get resource consumption metrics for an elastic database
trans-unit.target: Get resource consumption metrics for an elastic database

trans-unit.source: These APIs are the same as the current (V12) APIs used for monitoring the resource utilization of a standalone database, except for the following semantic difference
trans-unit.target: These APIs are the same as the current (V12) APIs used for monitoring the resource utilization of a standalone database, except for the following semantic difference

trans-unit.source: For this API metrics retrieved are expressed as a percentage of the per databaseDtuMax (or equivalent cap for the underlying metric like CPU, IO etc) set for that elastic database pool.
trans-unit.target: For this API metrics retrieved are expressed as a percentage of the per databaseDtuMax (or equivalent cap for the underlying metric like CPU, IO etc) set for that elastic database pool.

trans-unit.source: For example, 50% utilization of any of these metrics indicates that the specific resource consumption is at 50% of the per DB cap limit for that resource in the parent elastic database pool.
trans-unit.target: For example, 50% utilization of any of these metrics indicates that the specific resource consumption is at 50% of the per DB cap limit for that resource in the parent elastic database pool.

trans-unit.source: Get the metrics:
trans-unit.target: Get the metrics:

trans-unit.source: $metrics = (Get-Metrics -ResourceId /subscriptions/d7c1d29a-ad13-4033-877e-8cc11d27ebfd/resourceGroups/FabrikamData01/providers/Microsoft.Sql/servers/fabrikamsqldb02/databases/myDB -TimeGrain ([TimeSpan]::FromMinutes(5)) -StartTime "4/18/2015" -EndTime "4/21/2015")
trans-unit.target: $metrics = (Get-Metrics -ResourceId /subscriptions/d7c1d29a-ad13-4033-877e-8cc11d27ebfd/resourceGroups/FabrikamData01/providers/Microsoft.Sql/servers/fabrikamsqldb02/databases/myDB -TimeGrain ([TimeSpan]::FromMinutes(5)) -StartTime "4/18/2015" -EndTime "4/21/2015")

trans-unit.source: Get additional days if needed by repeating the call and appending the data:
trans-unit.target: Get additional days if needed by repeating the call and appending the data:

trans-unit.source: Format the table:
trans-unit.target: Format the table:

trans-unit.source: Export to a CSV file:
trans-unit.target: Export to a CSV file:

trans-unit.source: Putting it all together
trans-unit.target: Putting it all together

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: After creating an elastic database pool, you can manage elastic databases in the pool by creating elastic jobs.
trans-unit.target: After creating an elastic database pool, you can manage elastic databases in the pool by creating elastic jobs.

trans-unit.source: Elastic jobs facilitate running T-SQL scripts against any number of databases in the pool.
trans-unit.target: Elastic jobs facilitate running T-SQL scripts against any number of databases in the pool.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Elastic database jobs overview</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Elastic database jobs overview</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Elastic database reference
trans-unit.target: Elastic database reference

trans-unit.source: For more information about elastic databases and elastic database pools, including API and error details, see <link><linkText>Elastic database pool reference</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about elastic databases and elastic database pools, including API and error details, see <link><linkText>Elastic database pool reference</linkText><title></title></link>.
